qas.question: In which year did the Carnation Revolution take place?
What period followed the Carnation Revolution?
Since the 90's, how has Portugal's economic development model been changing?

answers.text: changing to a system that is focused on exports, private investment and the development of the high-tech sector

qas.question: What are the more traditional industries that have existed in Portugal?
What is Portugal the world's leading producer of?

context: Since the Carnation Revolution of <a0_0>1974<a0_0/>, which culminated in the end of one of Portugal's most notable phases of economic expansion (that started in the 1960s), a significant change has occurred in the nation's annual economic growth.[citation needed] After the turmoil of the 1974 revolution and the <a1_0>PREC period<a1_0/>, Portugal tried to adapt to a changing modern global economy, a process that continues in 2013. Since the 1990s, Portugal's public consumption-based economic development model has been slowly <a2_0>changing to a system that is focused on exports, private investment and the development of the high-tech sector<a2_0/>. Consequently, business services have overtaken more traditional industries such as <a3_0>textiles, clothing, footwear and cork<a3_0/> (Portugal is the world's leading <a4_0>cork<a4_0/> producer), wood products and beverages.
